languageKey.label: The map title.
If true, the marker is visible.
Record storge for categories to display on the map.
The initial Map mapTypeId. Required.
The initial width.
The initial height.
Color used for the background of the Map div. This color will be visible when tiles have not yet loaded as the user pans. This option can only be set when the map is initialized.
The initial Map center.
Record storge to display all listed layers on the map.
The initial Map zoom level. Required.
The minimum zoom level which will be displayed on the map. If omitted, or set to null, the minimum zoom from the current map type is used instead.
The maximum zoom level which will be displayed on the map. If omitted, or set to null, the maximum zoom from the current map type is used instead.
If true, do not clear the contents of the Map div.
Enables/disables all default UI. May be overridden individually.
The initial enabled/disabled state of the Map type control.
IDs of map types to show in the control.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. The default position is TOP_RIGHT.
Style id. Used to select what style of map type control to display.
The initial enabled/disabled state of the navigation control.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. The default position is TOP_LEFT.
Style id. Used to select what style of navigation control to display.
The initial enabled/disabled state of the scale control.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. The default position is BOTTOM_LEFT.
The enabled/disabled state of the pan control.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. The default position is TOP_LEFT.
The enabled/disabled state of the zoom control.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. The default position is TOP_LEFT.
Style id. Used to select what style of zoom control to display.
The initial enabled/disabled state of the Street View pegman control. The Street View pegman control is enabled by default.
Position id. Used to specify the position of the control on the map. Klick for details.

The default position is embedded within the navigation control. If this position is empty or the same as that specified in the navigationControlOptions, the Street View control will be displayed as part of the navigation control. Otherwise, it will be displayed separately.
Enables/disables zoom and center on double click. Enabled by default.
If false, disables scrollwheel zooming on the map. The scrollwheel is enabled by default.
If false, prevents the map from being dragged. Dragging is enabled by default.
The name or url of the cursor to display on a draggable object.
The name or url of the cursor to display when an object is dragging.
If false, prevents the map from being controlled by the keyboard. Keyboard shortcuts are enabled by default.
If set all info windows will keep open by clicking an other.
Set the behaviour for all info windows. If set to "For all" these properties will be overridden.
Placing type for the info window.
Position of the info window if type is a polyline or polygon. Klick for details.
There are three options: - Leave empty to place it in the center of the shape. - Set the number of the shape point (beginning with "1") - Set a coordinate like "48.475742,16.438696"

This option is a optionSplit configuaration. This settings have only effects on layers with the type marker or if "Add marker" is set. To parse more then one object in an info window seperate objects with an comma.
If set info windows will be closed by clicking the layer again.
If set all info windows will be closed if map is clicked.
Disable auto-pan on open. By default, the info window will pan the map so that it is fully visible when it opens.

Maximum width of the infowindow, regardless of content's width. This value is only considered if it is set before a call to open. To change the maximum width when changing content, call close, setOptions, and then open.

The offset, in pixels, of the tip of the info window from the point on the map at whose geographical coordinates the info window is anchored. If an InfoWindow is opened with an anchor, the pixelOffset will be calculated from the top-center of the anchor's bounds.

The offset, in pixels, of the tip of the info window from the point on the map at whose geographical coordinates the info window is anchored. If an InfoWindow is opened with an anchor, the pixelOffset will be calculated from the top-center of the anchor's bounds.
